Monster.Name: Bronze Scout

Description.Name: Clockworks
Description.Text: The gnomes’ efforts to invent and tinker with magic and mechanical devices produce many failed constructs, but also result in genuine advances, such as clockworks. Since their discovery, the methods used to craft clockworks have passed from one community of gnomes to another and down the generations. Constructed Nature. A clockwork doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

Description.Name: Individual Designs
Description.Text: A gnome artisan values an individualized clockwork more highly than a perfectly functioning one that copies too much from another creation⁠. A clockwork can be customized by adding clockwork enhancements.

TableEntry.Title: Camouflaged
TableEntry.Text: The clockwork gains proficiency in Stealth if it doesn’t already have it. While motionless, it is indistinguishable from a stopped machine.

TableEntry.Title: Sensors
TableEntry.Text: The range of the clockwork’s Darkvision becomes 120 feet, unless it is higher, and it gains proficiency in Perception if it doesn’t already have it.

TableEntry.Title: Improved Armor
TableEntry.Text: The clockwork’s AC increases by 2.

TableEntry.Title: Increased Speed
TableEntry.Text: The clockwork’s speed increases by 10 feet.

TableEntry.Title: Reinforced Construction
TableEntry.Text: The clockwork has resistance⁠ to force, lightning, and thunder damage.

TableEntry.Title: Self-Repairing
TableEntry.Text: If the clockwork starts its turn with at least 1 hit point, it regains 5 Hit Points. If it takes lightning damage, this ability doesn’t function at the start of its next turn.

TableEntry.Title: Sturdy Frame
TableEntry.Text: The clockwork’s hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to its number of Hit Dice.

TableEntry.Title: Suction
TableEntry.Text: The clockwork gains a climbing speed of 30 feet.

TableEntry.Title: Vocal Resonator
TableEntry.Text: The clockwork gains the ability to speak rudimentary Common or Gnomish (creator’s choice).

TableEntry.Title: Water⁠ Propulsion
TableEntry.Text: The clockwork gains a swimming speed of 30 feet.

TableEntry.Title: Faulty Sensors
TableEntry.Text: Roll a d6 at the start of the clockwork’s turn. If you roll a 1, the clockwork is Blinded until the end of its turn.

TableEntry.Title: Flawed Targeting
TableEntry.Text: Roll a d6 at the start of the clockwork’s turn. If you roll a 1, the clockwork makes Attack rolls with disadvantage until the end of its turn.

TableEntry.Title: Ground Fault
TableEntry.Text: The clockwork has vulnerability to lightning damage.

TableEntry.Title: Imprinting Loop
TableEntry.Text: Roll a d6 at the start of the clockwork’s turn. If you roll a 1, the clockwork mistakes one creature it can see within 30 feet for its creator. The clockwork won’t willingly harm that creature for 1 minute or until that creature attacks it or deals damage to it.

TableEntry.Title: Leaking Lubricant
TableEntry.Text: Roll a d6 at the start of the clockwork’s turn. If you roll a 1, the clockwork gains 1 level of Exhaustion that it isn’t immune to.

TableEntry.Title: Limited Steering
TableEntry.Text: The clockwork must move in a straight line. It can turn up to 90 degrees before moving and again at the midpoint of its Movement. It can rotate freely if it doesn’t use any of its speeds on its turn.

TableEntry.Title: Overactive Sense of Self-Preservation
TableEntry.Text: If the clockwork has half its Hit Points or fewer at the start of its turn in Combat, roll a d6. If you roll a 1, it retreats from combat⁠. If retreat isn’t possible, it continues fighting.

TableEntry.Title: Overheats
TableEntry.Text: Roll a d6 at the start of the clockwork’s turn. If you roll a 1, the clockwork is Incapacitated until the end of its turn.

TableEntry.Title: Rusty Gears
TableEntry.Text: The clockwork has disadvantage on Initiative rolls, and its speed decreases by 10 feet.

TableEntry.Title: Weak Armor
TableEntry.Text: The clockwork isn’t immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks that aren’t adamantine.

Monster.Description: A bronze scout seldom emerges from below ground; thanks to its telescoping eyestalks, it can observe enemies at close range while most of its segmented, wormlike body remains buried. If it is detected, the bronze scout deters pursuers by sending⁠ electrical shocks through the ground while it retreats to safety.
Monster.Flavour: Never depend on something built by a gnome. You can always rely on a gnome to take a good idea and make it impractical. —Mordenkainen

Immunities.string: bludgeoning from nonmagical attacks that aren’t adamantine
piercing from nonmagical attacks that aren’t adamantine
slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren’t adamantine

Languages.string: understands one language of its creator but can’t speak

MonsterTrait.Name: Earth Armor⁠
MonsterTrait.Text: The bronze scout doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it burrows.

MonsterTrait.Name: Magic Resistance⁠
MonsterTrait.Text: The bronze scout has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

MonsterAction.Name: Bite
MonsterAction.Text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning damage.

MonsterTrait.Name: Lightning⁠ Flare (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
MonsterTrait.Text: Each creature in contact with the ground within 15 feet of the bronze scout must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
